page.title: 03Governing Hunton
page.content: The five elected {Hunton Parish {councillors }have been kept very busy in 1984/5. Their main concern has been to improve the area around the village Institute at "the Greens." Whilst a separate committee has much improved the building's interior, the Manpower Services have been employed to re-lay the front verges and to construct a car park at the rear. Nearby wasteland is gradually being converted into a much needed recreation field. Money making events have had to be planned, volunteers co-opted. Dogs fouling the pavements, problems with the sewerage, worries about unstable trees, building applications,thoughtless parking, care for Common Land and the War Memorial, all have concerned the councillors. Three of them are also Hunton School Governors.Each one performs a valuable voluntary service to our community.
